Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Defensin 1 (natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; 3S=S; UCSS1a; JJsn)
Sequence Information.Crucial residues: Disulfide bonds: The peptide lost activity in the presence of >1.56 mM DTT (dithiothreitol).

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of  defensin 1 shows 50.7% similarity toinsect Tenecin 1.Activity: E. coli  Active against S. aureus MW2, USA100, USA300, USA400, RN4220, Newman, and clinical isolates including BF1,BF5, BF7 to BF11 and S. epidermidis 9142 (MIC 16-64 ug/ml). Of the 23 AMPs tested, only this peptide is effective against S. pneumoniae D39 (Lindhauer et al., 2019).Synergy:AMPs:  It showed synergistic effects with telavancin (synergy2) and daptomycin (synergy1).Antimicrobial robustness: Activity can be compromised by salts: NaCl-sensitive:S. aureus MW2 (50-100 mM); CaCl2-sensitive:S. aureus MW2 (1.25-100 mM).Animal model:Caenorhabditis elegans: it showed dose-dependent protection of animal survival against MRSA.Updated 10/2019; 4/2025
Literature Information.Author: Rajamuthiah R, Jayamani E, Conery AL, Fuchs BB, Kim W, Johnston T, Vilcinskas A, Ausubel FM, Mylonakis E.2015
Literature Information.Title: A Defensin from the Model Beetle Tribolium castaneum Acts Synergistically with Telavancin and Daptomycin against Multidrug Resistant Staphylococcus aureus
